title: Baltimore National Heritage Area: Basic Information
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information             Basic Information           Physical Address           12 W. Madison St., Ste 120  Baltimore, MD 21201                 Directions         The 18.2 square miles of the Baltimore National Heritage Area encompass the city's oldest neighborhoods as well as the downtown and waterfront areas.   Directions Details           Operating Hours & Seasons         Baltimore National Heritage Area http://explorebaltimore.org/   Standard Hours    Sunday: 10:00 AM - 4:00 PM   Monday: 10:00 AM - 4:00 PM   Tuesday: 10:00 AM - 4:00 PM   Wednesday: 10:00 AM - 4:00 PM   Thursday: 10:00 AM - 4:00 PM   Friday: 10:00 AM - 4:00 PM   Saturday: 10:00 AM - 4:00 PM             Weather           Weather can be extremely hot in the summer and extremely cold in the winter. Fall and spring very pleasant.         Fees & Passes     Entrance Fees:   Baltimore National Heritage Area - $0.00 Call main office for details   Entrance Passes:   Baltimore National Heritage Area - $0.00 Call main office for details         Visitor Centers              Â    The heritage area covers roughly 22 square miles. The core of the heritage area includes the historic neighborhoods around Baltimore's Inner Harbor. The heritage area extends west to include the Gwynns Falls and Leakin Park, and reaches north to include Druid Hill Park and the Cylburn Arboretum. The heritage area is not contiguous: Mount Auburn Cemetery is also included with the heritage area boundary. For more information visit: http://explorebaltimore.org/  Click for more information about Fees and Passes and Operating Hours and Seasons.
